G.T.5865
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 3rd OCTOBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front. North of ST. QUENTIN the Fourth Army attacked this morning and are reported to have made good progress. Unconfirmed reports say that we hold SEQUEHART, RAMICOURT, GOUY, and LE CATELET, with some troops in BEAUREVOIR and MONTBREHAIN.
Over 2,000 prisoners have been counted so far.
On the LA BASSES front the enemy's withdrawal continues and our troops have reached the following line :- GITE ST AUGUSTE, BENIFONTAINE, DOUVRIN, SALOME, AUBERS, west of BOIS GRENIER (south of ARMENTIERE).
On the YPRES front we have taken GHELUWE.
French Front. North of RHEIMS the French are reported to have taken VILLERS-FRANQUEUX and CAUROY and to have reached BERRY-AU-BAS. CORMICK is said to be held by the enemy.
In the ARGONNE the French Fourth Army have taken CHALLERANGE and ORFEUIL and several hundred prisoners.
2. ITALIAN FRONT. There is nothing to report.
3. MACEDONIAN FRONT. In ALBANIA the Italians began to advance on the morning of October 1st. FIERI, METALI, LALAD and the PANAHOR heights being occupied during the day. The advance has also progressed on the ZITOM heights, and further east the region of MALESOVA and LJUBESI has been reached.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
3rd October, 1918. Issued at 12.50 p.m.
